title: Crater Lake National Park: Weather data
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Environmental Factors     Weather     Weather data                  Crater Lake Weather Information      Crater Lake National Park has four weather stations.  One station, located near the Steel Visitors Center is operated by park rangers and reports daily data to the National Weather Service.  Three other stations, operated by park biologists for research purposes, reports hourly data to a publicly available website operated by the University of Utah - Department of Atmospheric Sciences.           Weather buoy floating on Crater Lake. NPS  Floating Lake Buoy    Click to go to the weather data collected from the weather station floating in the lake. This information is updated by 15 minutes past every hour.           Weather station located near park headquarters. NPS  Headquarters area  Click on the photo at left to go to the weather data collected from the weather station near employee housing and the park headquarters area. This information is updated by 15 minutes past every hour.            Weather station located on the rim of Crater Lake. NPS  Rim Village    Click on the photo to the right to go to the weather data collected from the weather station near Rim Village and the Lodge area. This information is updated by 30 minutes past every hour.
